searchDocs.title: Hello
searchDocs.content: Hello The docs are currently a work in progress, I'll be finishing them once I finish with other stuff.

searchDocs.title: RectList
searchDocs.content: RectList This is my first class.

searchDocs.title: Installation
searchDocs.content: Installation So uhmmm.... I mean if you want to use it now then you should clone the repo and build it. (I use argon btw). That or if you don't want the latest builds then feel free to get the build from the releases... (although it'll be kinda outdated.... ≧ ﹏ ≦)

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix.new( ...: number | Vector2 | Vector2int16 | Vector3 | Vector3int16 | table | boolean-- you get the idea ) → Matrix-- Returns the Matrix class Creates the Matrix value with the size in x, and y

searchDocs.title: fromMatrix​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix.fromMatrix( matrixVal: {{any}}-- the matrix Value ) → Matrix-- Returns the Matrix class Creates the Matrix value with a raw matrix value.

searchDocs.title: SetAll​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetAll(val: any) → () Set all the values in the Matrix to one value. Useful for setting up a Matrix.

searchDocs.title: RectSet​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:RectSet( rectVal: Rect , val: any ) → () Sets a certain area based on a Rect to a value

searchDocs.title: SetByChar​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetByChar( Char: any, val: any ) → () Sets all of a certain value contained in the Matrix to another Value, useful for setting booleans into characters.

searchDocs.title: SetByObject​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetByObject( str: string, val: any ) → () Sets all of a certain value contained in the Matrix to another Value based on the charset, useful for converting certain characters into another character.

searchDocs.title: SetRandomBool​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetRandomBool() → () Sets all of the Matrix's values to either true or false.

searchDocs.title: SetMultipleChars​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetMultipleChars( chars: any, val: any ) → () Sets all of a certain value contained in the Matrix to another Value, useful for setting booleans into characters.

searchDocs.title: GetNumOfChars​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:GetNumOfChars(val: any) → number returns the number of times a value is used within the Matrix.

searchDocs.title: AddOn​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:AddOn( otherMatrix: Matrix, offset: Vector2 -- Offsetted from the top left of the Matrix ) → () Adds a matrix over another matrix. Anything that's a false value won't be overlaid over the base matrix. If the other matrix being added onto the base matrix goes out of bounds then the out of bounds won't be counted. Can be offsetted from the top-left with offset.

searchDocs.title: Overlay​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Overlay( otherMatrix: Matrix, offset: Vector2 -- Offsetted from the top left of the Matrix ) → () Adds a matrix over another matrix. If the other matrix being added onto the base matrix goes out of bounds then the out of bounds won't be counted. Can be offsetted from the top-left with offset.

searchDocs.title: Mask​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Mask( otherMatrix: Matrix, offset: Vector2 -- Offsetted from the top left of the Matrix ) → () Adds a matrix over another matrix. Will overlay nil values but at the cost of performance. If the other matrix being added onto the base matrix goes out of bounds then the out of bounds won't be counted. Can be offsetted from the top-left with offset.

searchDocs.title: Extract​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Extract( p1: Vector2 , p2: Vector2 ) → Matrix Extracts a Matrix from one point to another, creating another Matrix.

searchDocs.title: FlipHorizontally​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:FlipHorizontally() → () lips the values in the Matrix on the x-axis.

searchDocs.title: FlipVertically​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:FlipVertically() → () lips the values in the Matrix on the y-axis.

searchDocs.title: Rotate90Clockwise​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Rotate90Clockwise() → () lips the values in the Matrix 90 degrees clockwise.

searchDocs.title: Rotate180​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Rotate180() → () lips the values in the Matrix upside down.

searchDocs.title: Rotate90CounterClockwise​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Rotate90CounterClockwise() → () lips the values in the Matrix 90 degrees counter-clockwise.

searchDocs.title: Invert​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Invert() → () nverts all booleans contained within the Matrix.

searchDocs.title: FlipNeighbors​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:FlipNeighbors() → () ill change all false values that are next to a true value into true.

searchDocs.title: Cull​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Cull() → Matrix Zooms in on areas that use a true value, useful for optimization.

searchDocs.title: InsertConnector​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:InsertConnector( p1: Vector2 , p2: Vector2 ) → () Inserts a Connector

searchDocs.title: ShowConnectors​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:ShowConnectors( StartChar: any, EndChar: any ) → () Change the values in the Matrix to that of the starting and ending connectors, will default to "S" and "E" respectively if no values for them are provided

searchDocs.title: SetStartingConnectors​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetStartingConnectors(val: Vector2 ) → () ets all starting connectors to one Vector2

searchDocs.title: SetEndingConnectors​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetEndingConnectors(val: Vector2 ) → () ets all ending connectors to one Vector2

searchDocs.title: GetFarthestConnectorIndex​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:GetFarthestConnectorIndex() → number Gets the Connector that has the highest magnitude.

searchDocs.title: Border​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Border(borderChar: any) → () ill surround the Matrix with a value

searchDocs.title: Wallify​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Wallify() → () ery niche but surrounds all Floor characters with a Wall character.

searchDocs.title: SetRandomChar​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:SetRandomChar() → () ets all values to a random character from the Charset

searchDocs.title: Print​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Print() → () eatly prints the Matrix in the terminal, will only work if all values are strings or numbers

searchDocs.title: Generate​
searchDocs.content: </> Matrix:Generate(BlueprintSelected: ModuleScript ) → () hile this function may appear to be useful, DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION. It takes a long time to load and causes lag! For that reason, it's only meant to be used as a way to debug stuff.
